Test Steps: 1. Open browser and go to http://localhost:5173|2. Enter username: admin|3. Enter password: admin123|4. Click Sign In
Expected Result: User is logged in and redirected to Dashboard. Sidebar shows all menu items including System Config and User Management.

Test Steps: 1. Open browser and go to http://localhost:5173|2. Enter username: officer1|3. Enter password: officer123|4. Click Sign In
Expected Result: User is logged in and redirected to Dashboard. Sidebar does NOT show System Config or User Management.

Test Steps: 1. Enter username: admin|2. Enter password: wrongpass|3. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Error message displayed: Invalid username or password. User stays on Login page.

Test Steps: 1. Enter username: unknown|2. Enter password: admin123|3. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Error message displayed. User stays on Login page.

Test Steps: 1. Leave both fields empty|2. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Form validation triggers. Browser shows required field warnings.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as any user|2. Click username in top-right|3. Click Logout
Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to Login page. Session is invalidated.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Navigate to Dashboard|3. Refresh the browser page (F5)
Expected Result: User remains logged in. Dashboard loads without redirecting to Login.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as officer1|2. Manually navigate to http://localhost:5173/config
Expected Result: Access Denied page shown. User is blocked from System Config.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as officer1|2. Manually navigate to http://localhost:5173/users
Expected Result: Access Denied page shown. User is blocked from User Management.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Observe the Dashboard page
Expected Result: Dashboard displays: Total FDs count | Active FDs count | Total Deposits | Premature Closures | Recent FDs table (last 5).

Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. View Recent FDs section on Dashboard
Expected Result: Up to 5 most recently created FDs appear. Each row shows FD number | customer name | amount | status. Clicking a row navigates to FD Details.

Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. Click Create FD button on Dashboard
Expected Result: User is navigated to the Create FD page.

Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. Go to Create FD|3. Set config to Simple Interest first|4. Fill all fields with valid data|5. Click Create FD
Test Data: Name=Ramesh Kumar | ID=Aadhaar | ID No=1234-5678-9012 | Amount=100000 | Rate=7.5 | Tenure=12 Months | Date=2026-02-19
Expected Result: FD created. FD number generated. Status=Active. Maturity Amount= 100000 × (1 + 0.075 × 1) = ₹107,500

Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. Set config to Compound Interest|3. Go to Create FD|4. Fill all fields|5. Click Create FD
Test Data: Name=Suresh Patel | Amount=100000 | Rate=7.5 | Tenure=12 Months
Expected Result: FD created. Maturity Amount= 100000 × (1.075)^1 = ₹107,500. (Same as simple for 1 year. Use 2 years to see difference)

Test Scenario: Create FD - Compound vs Simple Difference
Test Steps: 1. Set config to Compound|2. Create FD with 2 year tenure|3. Set config to Simple|4. Create another FD same inputs
1. Go to Create FD|2. Leave Customer Name blank|3. Fill all other fields|4. Click Create FD
Expected Result: Validation error shown: Customer name is required. FD is not created.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Enter Deposit Amount = 0|3. Fill all other fields|4. Click Create FD
Expected Result: Validation error shown: Deposit amount must be greater than 0.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Enter Deposit Amount = -5000|3. Click Create FD
Expected Result: Validation error shown. FD not created.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Enter Interest Rate = 25|3. Click Create FD
Expected Result: Validation error: Interest rate must be between 0 and 20%.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Enter Tenure = 0|3. Click Create FD
Expected Result: Validation error: Tenure must be greater than 0.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Enter Amount=100000|3. Enter Rate=7.5|4. Enter Tenure=12|5. Observe preview card
Expected Result: Preview card updates immediately showing Maturity Date | Interest Earned | Maturity Amount | Interest Type badge.

Test Steps: 1. Go to Create FD|2. Set Tenure Unit = Years|3. Enter Tenure = 2|4. Enter Amount=100000 Rate=8
Expected Result: FD created. Maturity date is exactly 2 years from start_date. Maturity amount calculated correctly.

Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. Go to FD Register
Expected Result: All FDs listed in table with columns: FD No | Customer | Amount | Rate | Tenure | Start Date | Maturity Date | Maturity Amount | Status.

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Select Status = Active|3. Click Filter
Expected Result: Only FDs with status Active are displayed.

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Select Status = Closed
Expected Result: Only FDs with status Closed are displayed.

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Enter customer name in search box
Expected Result: Only FDs matching the customer name appear (partial match supported).

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Enter Start Date From and To range
Expected Result: Only FDs within the date range appear.

Test Steps: 1. Apply any filter|2. Click Clear Filters button
Expected Result: All filters reset. All FDs shown again.

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Click any row
Expected Result: FD Details page opens for the selected FD.

Test Steps: 1. Filter by customer name = XXXXXXNOTEXIST
Expected Result: Empty state message shown: No FDs found matching your filters.

Test Steps: 1. Go to FD Register|2. Click any Active FD
Expected Result: FD Details page shows: Customer KYC section | FD Info section | Status badge | Created By | Maturity Date and Amount.

Test Steps: 1. Open any FD Details page|2. Click Download Receipt
Expected Result: PDF file downloads to browser. File named FD_Receipt_{fd_no}.pdf. PDF contains customer info and FD financial details.

Test Steps: 1. Open an Active FD|2. Click Simulate Premature Closure|3. Enter a date between start_date and maturity_date|4. Click Simulate
Expected Result: Breakdown shows: Days Held | Accrued Interest | Penalty Amount | Net Interest | Net Payout. FD status remains Active (no changes made).

Test Scenario: Simulate Premature Closure - Date Before Start
Test Steps: 1. Open an Active FD|2. Simulate|3. Enter closure date BEFORE start date
Expected Result: Error shown: Closure date must be after start date.

Test Scenario: Simulate Premature Closure - Date After Maturity
Test Steps: 1. Open an Active FD|2. Simulate|3. Enter closure date AFTER maturity date
Expected Result: Error shown: Closure date must be before maturity date.

Test Steps: 1. Open an Active FD|2. Simulate closure|3. Click Execute Premature Closure|4. Confirm in dialog
Expected Result: FD status changes to PrematurelyClosed. closed_at date stored. FD Register shows updated status. Action is irreversible.

Test Steps: 1. Open an Active FD|2. Click Execute Premature Closure|3. Cancel the confirmation dialog
Expected Result: FD status remains Active. No changes made.

Test Scenario: Mark as Matured - Before Maturity Date
Test Steps: 1. Open an FD where maturity_date is in the future
Expected Result: Mark as Matured button is NOT visible. Button only appears on or after maturity date.

Test Scenario: Mark as Matured - On or After Maturity Date
Test Steps: 1. Open an FD where maturity_date <= today|2. Click Mark as Matured|3. Confirm
Expected Result: FD status changes to Closed. FD Register shows status as Closed.

Test Scenario: Closed FD Has No Action Buttons
Test Steps: 1. Open a FD with status Closed or PrematurelyClosed
Expected Result: Simulate Closure | Execute Closure | Mark as Matured buttons are NOT visible. Only Download Receipt is available.

Test Steps: 1. Set config to Simple Interest|2. Create FD: Amount=100000 Rate=10% Tenure=12 months
Expected Result: Expected Maturity = 100000 × (1 + 0.10 × 1) = ₹110,000. Verify maturity_amount = 110000.00

Test Steps: 1. Set config to Compound Interest|2. Create FD: Amount=100000 Rate=10% Tenure=24 months
Expected Result: Expected Maturity = 100000 × (1.10)^2 = ₹121,000. Verify maturity_amount = 121000.00

Test Steps: 1. Config=Simple|2. Amount=100000 Rate=8% Tenure=24 months
1. Create FD: 100000 at 10% for 12 months|2. Simulate closure at 6 months|3. Config penalty=1%
Expected Result: Accrued Interest ≈ ₹4,929 (compound) or ₹5,000 (simple). Penalty ≈ ₹49-50. Net Payout ≈ ₹104,880-104,950.

Test Steps: 1. Set config penalty_percent=0|2. Simulate premature closure
Expected Result: Penalty Amount = ₹0. Net Interest = full Accrued Interest. Net Payout = Principal + full Accrued Interest.

Test Steps: Create FD start_date=2026-01-01 tenure=6 months
Expected Result: Maturity Date = 2026-07-01

Test Steps: Create FD start_date=2026-01-01 tenure=2 years
Expected Result: Maturity Date = 2028-01-01

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Go to System Config
Expected Result: System Config page loads showing current: Interest Type | Penalty % | Default rates for 12m/24m/36m.

Test Scenario: Save Config - Change to Simple Interest
Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Open System Config|3. Change Interest Type to Simple|4. Click Save
Expected Result: Config saved. Create FD page now shows Simple Interest formula in preview. New FDs use simple interest.

Test Scenario: Save Config - Change to Compound Interest
Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Open System Config|3. Change Interest Type to Compound|4. Click Save
Expected Result: Config saved. Create FD page shows Compound Interest formula. New FDs use compound interest.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Open System Config|3. Change Penalty to 2.0%|4. Save
Expected Result: Saved. Create a premature closure simulation to verify 2% penalty is applied.

Test Scenario: Default Rates Prefill on Create FD
Test Steps: 1. Set default_rate_12m=9.0 in config|2. Go to Create FD|3. Observe Interest Rate field
Expected Result: Interest Rate input is pre-filled with 9.0 when the page loads.

Test Scenario: Config Change Does Not Affect Existing FDs
Test Steps: 1. Create an FD with Compound interest|2. Change config to Simple|3. View old FD details
Expected Result: Old FD still shows interest_type_used = compound. Maturity amount unchanged.

Test Steps: 1. Set penalty_percent=0|2. Save
Expected Result: Saved successfully. Valid boundary value.

Test Steps: 1. Set penalty_percent=10|2. Save
Expected Result: Saved successfully. Valid upper boundary.

Test Steps: 1. Open System Config|2. Change values|3. Click Reset
Expected Result: Fields revert to the last saved values from the database. Unsaved changes lost.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Go to User Management
Expected Result: All users displayed in a table with: Username | Role | User ID | Created Date.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Go to User Management|3. Fill Create User form|4. Set Role=Officer|5. Click Create
Expected Result: User created. Appears in user table with role=officer.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Go to User Management|3. Create user with Role=Supervisor
Expected Result: User created with supervisor role. User can access all features.

Test Steps: 1. Create new user officer2/pass1234|2. Log out|3. Log in as officer2
Expected Result: New user logs in successfully and lands on Dashboard.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Try to create user with username=admin (already exists)
Expected Result: Error shown: Username already exists. User not created.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Create user with password=abc (< 6 chars)
Expected Result: Validation error: Password must be at least 6 characters.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as admin|2. Create user with username=ab (< 3 chars)
Expected Result: Validation error: minimum 3 characters required.

Test Steps: 1. Open login page on 1080p or higher screen
Expected Result: Entire login page (brand header + form + demo credentials) is visible without any vertical scrolling.

Test Steps: 1. Open browser Dev Tools (F12)|2. Set viewport to 375x812 (iPhone)|3. Navigate through pages
Expected Result: Sidebar collapses. Content stacks vertically. All text readable. No horizontal scroll.

Test Steps: 1. Set viewport to 768px width
Expected Result: Layout adjusts. Key features remain accessible. Navigation works.

Test Steps: 1. On a slow network|2. Trigger any API call (login / load FDs)
Expected Result: Loading spinner or text shown while API call is in progress. UI does not freeze.

Test Steps: 1. View FD Register with FDs of different statuses
Expected Result: Active = green badge | Closed = blue/grey badge | PrematurelyClosed = red/orange badge

Test Steps: 1. Enter username: ' OR '1'='1|2. Enter any password|3. Click Login
Expected Result: Login fails. Error message shown. No unauthorized access. Parameterized queries prevent SQL injection.

Test Steps: 1. Use browser dev tools or Postman|2. Call GET /fd without X-Session-Token header
Expected Result: API returns 401 Unauthorized. Data not returned.

Test Steps: 1. Log in as officer1|2. Try PUT /config via browser fetch or Postman with officer session token
Expected Result: API returns 403 Forbidden. Config not updated.

Test Scenario: Password Not Shown in API Response
Test Steps: 1. Log in|2. Call GET /auth/me|3. Check response
Expected Result: Response contains username and role only. Password hash is NOT returned.

Test Steps: 1. Open any FD|2. Click Download Receipt
Expected Result: PDF file downloads. File is named FD_Receipt_{fd_no}.pdf.

Test Steps: 1. Download receipt for a known FD|2. Open PDF|3. Verify data
Expected Result: PDF contains customer name | FD number | Deposit amount | Rate | Tenure | Start date | Maturity date | Maturity amount.

Test Steps: 1. Close an FD prematurely|2. Download its receipt
Expected Result: PDF correctly reflects the closed status and closure amounts.
